text: show is centered around songs from the
20s and 30s I like to call it an evening
of good old-fashioned entertainment but
I also take some modern songs and put
them in a vintage context I was so
inspired by that time period so I
started listening to a lot of music from
that time period and I realized it's so
wild it's so wrong in in a lot of ways
they were so much wilder than we are now
I think we think of times past we think
of these very proper people they were
doing it up back then and more and more
when I started listening to those songs
I started being inspired by this period
and thinking I want to do a whole show
that centers around this
nice to eat oh this is good to me kiss
I'd always been mostly a top 40 kind of
girl growing up as a child of the 80s
but this was always the soundtrack that
was on in the background my grandmother
and my mother and my family are
definitely big fans of the songbook but
it was daunting for me I started with
more contemporary unknown songs when I
started performing cabaret shows in
Chicago but especially having this
monthly show now I have the opportunity
to do a whole night dedicated to Harold
Arlen or cold porter or Dorothy Fields
or also more contemporary song writers
but having the different themes each
month has given me a chance to really
dive in to to the music of the great
Americans
this way to smell me we wait
